member.name: P:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.CreateOrderRequest.Amount
member.summary: Required. The amount of money to request.

remarks.para: The total for the customer to pay. This amount is validated against the sum of the amounts in the items attribute.

member.name: P:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.CreateOrderRequest.Tax
member.summary: Optional. The tax included in .

member.name: P:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.CreateOrderRequest.Currency
member.summary: Optional (but recommended). The currency the is in.

remarks.para: If omitted then the default currency associated with the merchant id is used. It is highly recommended a specific currency be provided rather than relying on defaults.

member.name: P:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.CreateOrderRequest.MerchantReference
member.summary: Required. A client generated reference for this request, used for idempotency.

member.name: P:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.CreateOrderRequest.Origin
member.summary: Required. A string identifying the calling system. Must be pre-registered with Laybuy.

remarks.para: Uses a default of POS if not specified and no default is specified via the value.

member.name: P:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.CreateOrderRequest.OriginData
member.summary: Required. An object to be serialised as json containing data specific to the value provided.

member.name: P:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.CreateOrderRequest.Customer
member.summary: Required (must provide ). Sets or returns a instance representing details of the customer for this request.

remarks.para: Requests made by systems for physical stores/branches *must* provide a value for the customer phone number.

member.name: P:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.CreateOrderRequest.Items
member.summary: Optional. Null or a collection of objects being purchased. Default value is null.

member.name: T:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.LaybuyClient
member.summary: Provides access to the REST endpoints exposed by Laybuy API using an idiomatic .Net, object-oriented model.

remarks.para: Instances of this class are thread-safe if that you can send requests through the same instance from multiple threads for different orders (MerchantReferences). Sending different requests for the same merchant reference simulatenously should be thread-safe in terms of this library code, but will be prone to potential race conditons on the API back end. Sending a cancel request for a client reference that is still being polled for on another thread is allowed, as the polling mechansim should repeat until the Laybuy API returns a cancelled status and no race condition should be present.

Instances of this class should be kept and reused as this allows HTTP connection pooling and improves performance. Instances should only be disposed when you no longer intend to use the instance again, such as on process shutdown or if changing the configuration of the client.
instances should not be modified after being passed into the construtor of an instance of this class.

member.name: M:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.LaybuyClient.#ctor(Yort.Laybuy.InStore.LaybuyClientConfiguration)
member.summary: Full constructor.

member.name: M:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.LaybuyClient.Cancel(Yort.Laybuy.InStore.CancelOrderRequest)
member.summary: Cancels a Laybuy previously created via the method.

remarks.para: An error will be returned if the Laybuy is already confirmed.

member.param: A instance containing details of the Laybuy to cancel.
member.returns: A indicating success if the Laybuy was cancelled ok, otherwise error details.
member.exception: Thrown if is null.
Thrown if is an empty string or only whitespace.
May be thrown in the event of a timeout calling the Laybuy API.
May be thrown in the event of a timeout calling the Laybuy API.

Thrown if the call to the Laybuy API returns an error response code. The Laybuy API does not use HTTP response codes for 'business level errors', such as 'order not found' or 'declined', so this type of exception typically represents a problem such as bad credentials, a bad gateway/DNS, server unavailable etc.

member.name: M:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.LaybuyClient.Create(Yort.Laybuy.InStore.CreateOrderRequest)
member.summary: Creates a new order at Laybuy.
member.param: A with details of the order to create.

remarks.para: If is null and and/or are non empty in the settings object used to construct this client then a new instance is automatically created with appropriate values and applied to the request. If no default value can be applied then is thrown.
See the Laybuy documenation at: https://integrations.laybuy.com/reference#post_order-create-1

member.returns: A indicating the outcome of the request.
member.exception: Thrown if request, , , or is null.
Thrown if request, , , or is an empty string or only whitespace..
Thrown if is zero or negative.

member.name: M:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.LaybuyClient.Refund(Yort.Laybuy.InStore.RefundRequest)
member.summary: Refunds an amount of money against a Laybuy previously created via .
member.param: A with details of the refund to make.
member.returns: A indicating the outcome of the request.

remarks.para: If you need to retry a refund due to a transient error or interruption (power failure/crash) ensure the same *RefundReference* is used on each retry attempt. This should ensure idempotency and prevent multiple refunds being issued by mistake.

member.name: T:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.LaybuyClientConfiguration
member.summary: Provides configuration settings for and default values for some requests..

member.name: M:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.LaybuyClientConfiguration.#ctor(Yort.Laybuy.InStore.LaybuyCredentials)
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: P:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.LaybuyClientConfiguration.Environment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value from the enum specifying whether this client connects to the production or sandboxed (test) Laybuy API.

remarks.para: The default value is to prevent accidental live transactions. Production systems must specify for real payments to occur.

member.name: P:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.LaybuyClientConfiguration.Credentials
member.summary: Gets or sets a instance used to authenticate to the Laybuy API.

member.name: P:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.LaybuyClientConfiguration.CallbackUrlTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing a template used to automatically generate callback urls for .

remarks.para: This value can be left null if you do not require callbacks. The default value is null. Callbacks are not typically used with the in store process (normally they used as part of an e-commerce workflow) but they are referred to in the Laybuy documenation for the POS API so they've been implemented in this library where mentions by that documentation.
You can use the (case-sensitive) tag {merchantReference} in the template string, it will be replaced with the merchant reference of the request the url is generated for.
Sample: https://www.mydomain.com/callbacks/laybuy/{merchantReference}

member.name: P:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.LaybuyClientConfiguration.HttpClientFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets a function that create an to be used to communicate with Laybuy. Can be null, in which case the system will create it's own instance.

member.name: P:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.LaybuyClientConfiguration.DefaultOrigin
member.summary: Gets or sets the default value.

remarks.para: The default value is "POS".

member.name: P:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.LaybuyClientConfiguration.DefaultBranch
member.summary: Gets or sets the default value for which is applied if no origin data is specified on a .

member.name: T:Yort.Laybuy.InStore.LaybuyCustomerBase
member.summary: Provides details about a customer to/from Laybuy.

remarks.para: Unfortunately the Laybuy API isn't consistent in it's format of customer entities, with the shape of the entity varying when it's used on a request vs. a response. This class provided properties common to a Laybuy customer entity in either direction. See and classes for the full entities.

member.summary: Required. The mobile phone number of the customer.

remarks.para: The customer's mobile phone number must be provided for requests so the can be sent the payment link via SMS.
